reviewText: I just love  The love comes softly series, so l wanted in my home .

These four movies are the start of a wonderful series set in the second half of the nineteenth century.

BUT I'm going to recommend that you not buy this set. For the same price, you can purchase the Tenth Anniversary Edition that contains TEN movies, average price less that a dollar per movie.

I recommend: . . . LOVE COMES SOFTLY - 10TH ANNIVERSARY COLLECTION (see picture)

In the first two movies, we see life on the prairie, as two widows find each other and get married as platonic friends, a friendship that grows into love. We see the man's daughter grow from not wanting another mother to being very glad to have a mother again. In "Love's Enduring Promise," the first movie in this 2-movie set, the daughter, now a teacher, meets and must choose between two very different suitors, but there is so much more in the movie. In "Love's Long Journey," we see Missy and Willie leave the prairie to become cattle ranchers and start a new family.
Loved this collection.  Old time warmth with loving family ties is a theme.
omg the best set of movies ever wonderfull for all ages very heart warmingLove Comes Softly (10th Anniversary Collection)

These 4 are the best of the Love Saga. I bought an extra set for a family that loves family friendly movies. I would buy this again and recommend this series. Love these movies. If you love Little House, you will love this also!
This was a Christmas gift for my neice. Fast shipping, great price and she loved it.

These DVDs are beautifully and tenderly done.
Wonderful, I love them
Move movies should be made like these

This series is touching, but it drags on a bit too long. The first movie can stand alone (Love Comes Softly), the rest just kind of create too much drama. I can understand that life has challenges but really for it to drag on for so long it was a little annoying.
Overall I liked Love Comes Softly. If you can stop with that you will have seen the best.  Unfortunately most people are probably like me and just have a dying itch to scratch and watch the rest in the series. It isn't a waste of time really. They are all enjoyable, just a little tedious at parts.
